docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 30 -- The disputes between the colonial and non-colonial powers that took up much of the time in Trusteeship Committee debates probably will be resumed tomorrow on the floor of the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Oct. 30 -- The disputes between the colonial and non-colonial powers that took up much of the time in Trusteeship Committee debates probably will be resumed tomorrow on the floor of the United Nations General Assembly at Flushing Meadow.

headline.main: U.N. ASSEMBLY GETS TRUSTEE PROBLEMS; Meeting Today at Flushing Will Consider Moves to Reverse Committee on Information

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31 (AP) -- A campaign by Senator Kenneth S. Wherry, Republican, of Nebraska, to block the sale of 100 Government-owned tankers to foreign governments -- once carried to the White House -- was laid before Senate and House leaders of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 31 (AP) -- A campaign by Senator Kenneth S. Wherry, Republican, of Nebraska, to block the sale of 100 Government-owned tankers to foreign governments -- once carried to the White House -- was laid before Senate and House leaders of both parties today.

headline.main: WHERRY ADVANCES TANKER SALE FIGHT; Asks Senate, House Leaders to Block Foreign Buying in Interests of U.S. Defense

docs.snippet: ZURICH, Switzerland, Nov. 2 -- Numerous international holding companies originally registered in the tiny principality of Liechtenstein to escape the increasing taxation in their own countries are on the point of transferring their headquarters to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ZURICH, Switzerland, Nov. 2 -- Numerous international holding companies originally registered in the tiny principality of Liechtenstein to escape the increasing taxation in their own countries are on the point of transferring their headquarters to Tangier, the intenationalized zone of North Africa opposite Gibraltar.
docs.abstract: Use as haven for exch dealers fleeing Eur curbs discussed

headline.main: Tangier Now a Haven of Capital Fleeing Europe's Tight Controls; International Zone Offers Safe, Tax-Free Home for 'Nervous' Cash -- Holding Companies to Move From Liechtenstein to Africa

docs.snippet: Week Ended Oct. 31, 1947 Pound sterling for spot and forward positions pointed off again last week with the chief weight of the decline found more in the spot document than in the bill rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended Oct. 31, 1947 Pound sterling for spot and forward positions pointed off again last week with the chief weight of the decline found more in the spot document than in the bill rates.

docs.snippet: Efforts by India and the Soviet Union to have the United Nations bring pressure on Britain, Belgium, the Netherlands, France and other colonial powers to submit political information on their colonies were finally blocked yesterday by the General...
docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts by India and the Soviet Union to have the United Nations bring pressure on Britain, Belgium, the Netherlands, France and other colonial powers to submit political information on their colonies were finally blocked yesterday by the General Assembly at Flushing Meadow.

headline.main: INDIA, SOVIET LOSE IN COLONIAL DEBATE; 5 U.N. Assembly Resolutions Reverse Decisions by the Trusteeship Committee

docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 5 -- Reports that the committee of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange is investigating the boom in Middle Witwatersrand gold shares that preceded publication on Monday of high gold values caused speculators to take profits in the stock...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 5 -- Reports that the committee of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange is investigating the boom in Middle Witwatersrand gold shares that preceded publication on Monday of high gold values caused speculators to take profits in the stock markets here today.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Gold Boom Inquiry Sets Off Profit-Taking but Sharp Recovery Follows

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: With the huge war-built fleet of tankers of the United States Government now reduced to a comparatively low level through sales and other disposals, the amount of fuel oil and other petroleum products that may be made available to the North Atlantic...
docs.lead_paragraph: With the huge war-built fleet of tankers of the United States Government now reduced to a comparatively low level through sales and other disposals, the amount of fuel oil and other petroleum products that may be made available to the North Atlantic Coast area this winter will depend in part on the extent to which the remainder of these vessels is used to meet the requirements of the Northeast.
docs.abstract: tanker shortage discussed; East Coast Winter oil supply hinges on disposal of remaining Govt-held 145; foreign sales linked to Marshall Plan; opposition factors discussed; Navy and Maritime Comm free laid-up 50 but operation must await reconditioning; tanker status as of July 15 noted

headline.main: TANKER SHORTAGE GROWS MORE ACUTE; 145 Still Held by Maritime Commission Not Yet Turned Over to Companies NAVY HELPS EASE LACK 24 Taken From 'Tie-Up' Fleet for Active Service in Fuel-Oil Delivery in East TANKER SHORTAGE GROWS MORE ACUTE

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 8 -- Lester B. Pearson, Canadian Under-Secretary of External Affairs, moved today to break the deadlock between the United States and the Soviet Union on how the proposed partitioning of Palestine is to be carried out.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 8 -- Lester B. Pearson, Canadian Under-Secretary of External Affairs, moved today to break the deadlock between the United States and the Soviet Union on how the proposed partitioning of Palestine is to be carried out.

headline.main: CANADIAN ASKS END OF MANDATE JAN. 1, BRIEF BRITISH STAY; Pearson's Proposal Envisages Troops in Palestine Till Jews and Arabs Form Regimes SMALL COMMISSION URGED Dominion Spokesman Would Have It Responsible to Council, Not Assembly CANADA ASKS END OF MANDATE JAN. 1

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON -- From Mexico down through Central and South America to the lower reaches of Argentina there is a shortage of new passenger automobiles which, on the basis of population, exceeds that even in the United States.
